did.unittitle: Indiana University Department of Athletics Manager's Books

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Indiana University, Department of Intercollegiate Athletics

did.abstract: The Department of Athletics was officially established by the Board of Trustees in 1933 upon the dismantling of its predecessor, the Athletic Board of Control, which existed as early as 1917. The collection consists of Manager Books for Baseball, Basketball, Cross Country and Track, Football, Gymnastics, Swimming, and Wrestling from 1922-1971.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Advance notice required.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: The Department of Athletics was officially established by the Board of Trustees in 1933 upon the dismantling of its predecessor, the Athletic Board of Control, which existed as early as 1917. The Athletic Board of Control was a voluntary independent organization composed of members of Indiana University's faculty and alumni. The Department of Athletics is overseen by a Committee of twelve members under the supervision and control of Indiana University's President and Board of Trustees. This twelve person Committee is appointed annually by the Board of Trustees and serves for one year.

IU's first known athletic activity was the formation of the men's baseball team, which was organized in 1867 by veteran students returning from the Civil War. Twenty-two of Indiana University's sports, including baseball, participate in Division I of the National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA). Additionally, on December 1, 1899 Indiana University became a member of the Big Ten Conference.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized by alphabetical order by sport [Baseball, Basketball, Cross Country and Track (individual volumes in Track also included in this set), Football, Gymnastics, Swimming, and Wrestling)] and then in chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of Manager Books for Baseball, Basketball, Cross Country and Track, Football, Gymnastics, Swimming, and Wrestling from 1922-1971. The collection is organized in alphabetical order by sport and then in chronological order. Each book contains manager reports, game scores, player statistics and other game records along with photographs and newspaper clippings and other press releases related to the team for that particular year.

The Department of Athletics boasts a rich history that highlights some of IU's "firsts" for the university. The baseball team, which was first organized in 1867 by veteran students returning from the Civil War, became IU's first known athletic activity. Preston Eagleson, who became part of the football team in 1893, was the first African American athlete as well as the first African American to receive an advanced degree from IU. The first women's sport began in 1897 with women's basketball. These Manager Books provide the researcher with a continuation of these stories by highlighting events and history related to these teams as well as other IU athletics not long after their formation.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional records such as newsletters, annual reports, bulletins, and publications may be accessed in the Archives of Institutional Memory: http://institutionalmemory.iu.edu/aim/
Archived web sites for this Department may be included in Archive-It: http://www.archive-it.org/collections/219
Related photographs may be available in the University Archives Photographs Database: http://webapp1.dlib.indiana.edu/archivesphotos/

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyrights for records originating with Indiana University administrative units, departments, and other offices are held by the Trustees of Indiana University. For more information, please contact the Indiana University Archives staff.

The Indiana University Archives respects the intellectual property rights of others and does not claim any copyrights for non-university records, materials in the public domain, or materials for which we do not hold a Deed of Gift. Responsibility for the determination of the copyright status of these materials rests with those persons wishing to reuse the materials. Researchers are responsible for securing permission from copyright owners and any other rights holders for any reuse of these materials that extends beyond fair use or other statutory limitations.

Digital reproductions of archival materials from the Indiana University Archives are made available for noncommercial educational and research purposes only. If you are the copyright holder for any of the digitized materials and have questions about its inclusion on our site, please contact the Indiana University Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Indiana University Department of Athletics Manager's Books, Collection C624, Indiana University Archives, Bloomington.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: 2003/137 transferred from HPER Library to the University Archives November 13, 2003 through Michael Courtney. 2008/059 transferred from Department of Athletics in Assembly Hall to the University Archives July 26, 2008 through Rick Greenspan.

(There are also group photo from a meet-s showing Abie Grossfield (Illinois), Don Tonry (Illinois), Duane Hoecherl (Minnesota), Bill Buck (Iowa), Angelo Festa (Michigan State), John Daniels (Michigan State), Jim Hayslett (Michigan), Rich Montpetit (Michigan), Jerry Jacquin (Indiana), Larry Snyder (Iowa), Ed Cole (Michigan), Frank Newman (Michigan),Chuck Thompson (Michigan State), Jim Blazek (Illinois), Pat Bird (Illinois), Al Stall (Michigan), Stan Tarshis (MichiganState), Nino Marion (Michigan), Bob Schwarzkopf (Minnesota), Ron Walden (Indiana), Jim Brown (Michigan), Bill Skinner (Michigan), Dave Dulaney (Penn State), and JackWiley (Southern Illinois).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Robert Baechle, Paul E. Brown, Leonard A. Bryson, John R. Burkel, Arthur J. Canning, Virgil E. Ecton, Jerome Jacquin, Thomas S. Lancaster, Larry L. Miltenberger, and A. David Nawrocki. There are also group shots at a meet-s of Jack Wiley (Southern Illinois), Al Barasch (Illinois), Len Kalakian (Southern Illinois), Dave Nawrocki (Indiana), and Jack Ryder (Florida State). There is also an informal shot of 10 persons during a meet (all IU gymnasts?).
